key_title: Key to the species of Epacris

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Ericaceae

source.author: Albrecht, D.E.
source.title: Epacridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Albrecht, D.E. (1996). Epacridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla tube shorter than or occasionally almost equal to corolla lobes; style less than 2.5 mm long
Corolla tube longer than corolla lobes; style more than 2.5 mm long
Leaf base weakly to strongly cordate (rarely obtuse-truncate); flowers usually extending down the branches
Leaf base cuneate to obtuse; flowers in terminal heads or extending down the branches
Leaf apex acuminate, the tip usually pungent; leaves 2–6.5 mm long; petiole 0.2–0.5 mm long
Leaf apex abruptly contracted to a blunt or broadly acute, incurved tip; leaves 1.5–3 mm long; petiole 0.5–1 mm long
Flowers extending down branchlets forming leafy, spike-like inflorescences
Flowers chiefly in compact head-like clusters on tips of branchlets
Leaf apices acuminate, tapered to a mucro c. 0.5 mm long or more; leaves 4–10 mm long
Leaf apices blunt, sometimes with a mucro (but then the mucro not more than c. 0.2 mm long); leaves to 4 (rarely to 5.5) mm long
Leaves distinctly keeled beneath, usually appressed to subappressed, margins quite acute; Baw Baw Plateau, Lake Mountain and Snowy Range only
Leaves not or obscurely keeled beneath, usually spreading, margins distinctly thickened or not, but hardly acute

Style c. 0.5 mm long; leaves elliptic to obovate, margins distinctly thickened and obtuse, apex sometimes minutely mucronate; rather widespread in alps and subalps (but not Baw Baw Plateau or Lake Mountain)
Style c. 1 mm long; leaves often ± rhombic, margins not distinctly thickened, apex never mucronate; Bogong High Plains only
Leaf apex obtuse and incurved
Leaf apex acute to acuminate and mucronate
Corolla white, pink or red, the tube 4–20 mm long and at least twice the length of the calyx, with 5 small indentations near the base; style (4–) 7–24 mm long, not thicker in the middle third
Corolla white, the tube 4–8 mm long and less than twice the length of the calyx, lacking indentations near the base; style 4–7.5 mm long, thicker in the middle third
Style pubescent over at least the central third; ovary puberulent; lowland sites
Style and ovary glabrous; mainly montane to subalpine sites but descending to lowlands in East Gippsland
